The great assembly of practitioners in this Dharma assembly today, all sentient beings have grudges and grievances. How
can we know this?
If there were no grudges and grievances, then there would be no evil realms.
Now the evil realms do not cease, and the three evil paths are boiling for a long time.
This shows that grudges and grievances are endless.
The sutra says:
All sentient beings have minds.
Those with minds can all become Buddhas.
But the thoughts of sentient beings are upside down.
They sleep long in birth and death, unable to awaken and realize. They crave the worldly and do not know how to escape.
They establish the root of suffering and nurture the root of resentment.
Therefore, they revolve in the three realms and come and go in the six paths.
They abandon one body and receive another, without a moment's rest.
Why is this so?
All sentient beings, since beginningless time,
have transmitted in their dark consciousnesses, covered by ignorance.
They are drowned in the waters of craving.
They give rise to the roots of the three poisons.

Based on the five mistaken views, sixty-two views arise.
Based on body, speech, and mind, ten evil deeds arise.
Body: killing, stealing, and sexual misconduct.

Ignorance covers wisdom.
Afflictions cover the mind.
